TEXT.English: Your Missionary was not successful when trying to convince the Natives of this village of the evilness of their white neighbours.
TEXT.French: Â ýòîì ñåëåíèè âàøåìó ìèññèîíåðó íå óäàëîñü óáåäèòü òóçåìöåâ â !!!íå÷åñòèâîñòè, ïîðî÷íîñòè, ðàçâðàòíîñòè!!! ñâîèõ ñîñåäåé.
TEXT.German: Euer Missionar war bei dem Versuch, die Einwohner dieses Dorfes von der Bösartigkeit ihrer weissen Nachbarn zu überzeugen, nicht erfolgreich.
TEXT.Italian: Il tuo missionaria non è riuscita quando si cerca di convincere i nativi di questo villaggio della malvagità dei loro vicini bianchi.
TEXT.Spanish: Su Misionero no tuvo éxito al tratar de convencer a los nativos de este pueblo de la maldad de sus vecinos blancos.

TEXT.English: Your Missionary successfully convinced some young Natives of this village to raid their evil white neighbours.

TEXT.German: Euer Missionar hat die Einwohner dieses Dorfes erfolgreich zu einem Überfall auf ihre bösen weißen Nachbarn überzeugt.

TEXT.English: The Prisoners we have bought from our King have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.German: Die Gefangenen, die wir erworben haben, sind in %s1_city angekommen, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: I prigionieri che abbiamo comprato dal nostro re sono arrivati in %s1_city, mio signore.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Prisioneros que hemos comprado a nuestro Rey han llegado %s1_city, Milord.

TEXT.English: It takes years to acquire the knowledge, contacts and rhetorical ability to become a successful Statesman. However, most Noblemen had very good education and had been prepared for a life in high society from their birth on. Their knowledge of law and legal proceedings makes them crucial to maintaining order and discipline in a growing colony. Further, their strength, passion and skill as orators makes them powerful weapons for a colony wishing to become its own nation.
TEXT.French: Òðåáóþòñÿ ãîäû, ÷òîáû ïðèîáðåñòè çíàíèå, êîíòàêòû è îðàòîðñêóþ ñïîñîáíîñòü,äëÿ òîãî ÷òîá ñòàòü óñïåøíûì Ãîñóäàðñòâåííûì äåÿòåëåì. Îäíàêî áîëüøèíñòâî Äâîðÿí èìåëî î÷åíü õîðîøåå îáðàçîâàíèå è áûëî ïîäãîòîâëåíî ê æèçíè â âûñøåì îáùåñòâå ñ èõ ðîæäåíèÿ. Èõ çíàíèå çàêîíà è ïðîöåññóàëüíûõ äåéñòâèé äåëàåò èõ êðàéíå âàæíûìè äëÿ ïîääåðæàíèÿ ïîðÿäêà è äèñöèïëèíû â ðàñòóùåé êîëîíèè. Äàëåå, èõ ñèëà, ñòðàñòü è ñïîñîáíîñòè êàê îðàòîðû äåëàþò èõ ìîùíûì îðóæèåì äëÿ êîëîíèè, æåëàþùåé ñòàòü åå ñîáñòâåííîé ñòðàíîé.
TEXT.German: Man braucht Jahre, um das Wissen, die Kontakte und die rhetorischen Fähigkeiten zu erlangen, die man benötigt, um ein erfolgreicher Staatsmann zu sein. Ein Edelmann wurde aber meist seit Kindheit auf Diplomatie und Politik vorbereitet. Des weiteren sind Geld und Bekanntheit seit jeher wichtige Einflussfaktoren. Manche Edelnmänner der Alten Welt werden vom Reiz des Abenteuers oder vom Ruf idealistischer neuer Pfade in die Neue Welt gezogen und stellen ihren Einfluss den dortigen Kräften zur Verfügung.
TEXT.Italian: Ci vogliono anni per acquisire la conoscenza, i contatti e l'abilità retorica per diventare uno statista di successo. La conoscenza della legge e dei procedimenti legali rende gli statisti cruciali per il mantenimento dell'ordine e della disciplina in una colonia in crescita. Inoltre la loro forza, passione e abilità come oratori li rendono potenti armi per una colonia che vuole trasformarsi in nazione.
TEXT.Spanish: Cuesta años conseguir el conocimiento, los contactos y la capacidad retórica necesarios para ser un Estadista de éxito. Su conocimiento de las normas y de los procedimientos legales hace que sean cruciales para mantener el orden y la disciplina en una colonia creciente. Además, su fuerza, su pasión y su habilidad como oradores los convierte en armas poderosas para un asentamiento que desee independizarse.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Famous Noblemen[COLOR_REVERT] are expert [LINK=YIELD_BELLS]Liberty Bell[\LINK] producers. in the [LINK=PROFESSION_STATESMAN]Statesman[\LINK] profession, they are even more effective even than [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Elder Statesmen[\LINK], but also very rare. They are available through some [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] and are also provided by some [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Ðîäîâûå äâîðÿíå[COLOR_REVERT] ÿâëÿþòñÿ õîðîøèìè ýêñïåðòàìè â ñîçäàíèè «[LINK=YIELD_BELLS]Êîëîêîëà Ñâîáîäû[\LINK]». Îíè ïðîôåññèîíàëüíûå [LINK=PROFESSION_STATESMAN]Ãîñóäàðñòâåííûå äåÿòåëè[\LINK], èõ äåÿòåëüíîñòü áîëåå ýôôåêòèâíà è ïðîãðåññèâíà, ÷åì äåÿòåëüíîñòü [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Ñòàðåéøèí[\LINK], íî èõ î÷åíü ìàëî. Îíè ïîÿâëÿþòñÿ â ðåçóëüòàòå êàêèõ-òî [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Ñîáûòèé[\LINK], èëè èõ ðåêîìåíäóþò â ïðàâëåíèå ãîñóäàðñòâîì «[LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Îòöû-Îñíîâàòåëè[\LINK]».

Asignar a uno de ellos a la profesión de Estadista doblará el número de [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Campanas de la libertad[COLOR_REVERT] producidas.

TEXT.English: [BOLD]Strategy[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Trapperhuts[COLOR_REVERT] can be built in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK], [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forests[\LINK] and [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST_TUNDRA]Taiga[\LINK], on [LINK=TERRAIN_TUNDRA]Tundra[\LINK] and [LINK=TERRAIN_SNOW]Permafrost[\LINK] terrain, as well as tiles with the [LINK=BONUS_BISON]Bisons[\LINK] bonus. They boost the production of [LINK=YIELD_FUR]Fur[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_PREMIUM_FUR]Premium Fur[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Hunting and Trapping wild animals like Deers and Beavers used to be a very lonely job far away from civlization and people in the cities. During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.

During the months of the hunting seasons the hunters and trappers lived in their trappers huts and left usually left those only for selling their furs.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Jagd auf Rehe, Biber und andere Tiere fand meist weit abseits der Städte statt. Während der Jagdsaison lebten die Jäger und Trapper oft monatelang in einsamen Jagdhütten und verliessen diese nur zum Verkauf ihrer Waren in den Städten.

TEXT.English: Horses

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] live on flat [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forest[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Arguably the most useful domesticated animal in mankind's history, horses have existed for some 50 million years. While significant evolution has taken place (early ancestors were under a foot tall), the basic appearance of the horse has remained relatively unchanged. The earliest interaction between horses and men was that of game, with early man hunting them for food. Around 2500 BC, the first signs of domesticated breeds began appearing in Asia, but the idea took hold and spread rapidly. The contributions of the horse to man's conquest of his fellow man were immense, enabling the vast campaigns by Genghis Khan and Alexander the Great. The Spaniards introduced the modern breed to North America in the 16th Century, often turning their imported herds loose before returning to Europe (making valuable room for gold and other treasures). While the importance of horses has dwindled since the advent of the internal combustion engine, they remain a boon in the realms of entertainment and farming.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Horses[COLOR_REVERT] live on flat [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] or [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forest[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Arguably the most useful domesticated animal in mankind's history, horses have existed for some 50 million years. While significant evolution has taken place (early ancestors were under a foot tall), the basic appearance of the horse has remained relatively unchanged. The earliest interaction between horses and men was that of game, with early man hunting them for food. Around 2500 BC, the first signs of domesticated breeds began appearing in Asia, but the idea took hold and spread rapidly. The contributions of the horse to man's conquest of his fellow man were immense, enabling the vast campaigns by Genghis Khan and Alexander the Great. The Spaniards introduced the modern breed to North America in the 16th Century, often turning their imported herds loose before returning to Europe (making valuable room for gold and other treasures). While the importance of horses has dwindled since the advent of the internal combustion engine, they remain a boon in the realms of entertainment and farming.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pferde[COLOR_REVERT] gedeihen besonders gut auf flachem Gelände der [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK], des [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Graslands[\LINK] oder der [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK]. Gelegentlich können besonders gute Zuchtweiden auch von [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] überwachsen sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintegrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Pferde gibt es seit mehr als 50 Millionen Jahren. Sie sind die wohl nützlichsten domestizierten Tiere in der Geschichte der Menschheit. Obwohl sich ihr Äußeres im Laufe der Jahre kaum verändert hat, haben die Pferde eine bedeutende Evolution durchlaufen. Immerhin waren ihre frühzeitlichen Artgenossen nur etwa 30 cm groß. Ursprünglich jagten die Menschen Pferde zu Nahrungszwecken. Erst um 2500 vor Christus tauchten die ersten domestizierten Züchtungen in Asien auf. Diese Idee wurde so gut angenommen, dass sie sich schnell in andere Länder ausbreitete. Ihr Beitrag zur Ausbreitung der Völker war enorm, da erst die Pferde die gewaltigen Feldzüge Dschingis Khans und Alexanders des Großen ermöglichten. Im 16. Jahrhundert brachten die Spanier die heutigen Pferderassen nach Nordamerika. Oft ließen sie dort ihre Herden zurück, um auf ihren Schiffen mehr Platz für Gold und andere erbeutete Schätze zu haben. Obwohl die Bedeutung des Pferdes seit der Erfindung des Verbrennungsmotors deutlich rückläufig ist, hat es in der Landwirtschaft und im Sport bis heute einen festen Platz.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I cavalli esistono da 50 milioni di anni e sono senza dubbio gli animali più utili nella storia dell'umanità. Malgrado si siano evoluti in maniera rilevante (i loro antenati erano alti poco meno di 30 centimetri), il loro aspetto è rimasto praticamente invariato. Inizialmente, gli uomini erano soliti andare a caccia di cavalli per cibarsene, ma, attorno al 2500 a. C., in Asia apparvero i primi segni di razze di cavalli addomesticati e ben presto l'idea prese piede e si diffuse rapidamente. Il contributo del cavallo nelle conquiste dell'uomo è stato immenso, rendendo possibili anche le grandi campagne militari di Genghis Khan e Alessandro Magno. A partire dal 16° secolo, gli spagnoli hanno introdotto nel Nordamerica le razze moderne, spesso liberando le proprie mandrie prima di tornare in Europa (creando così spazio fondamentale per oro e altre ricchezze). Malgrado l'importanza dei cavalli sia venuta meno con l'avvento dei motori a combustione interna, sono ancora fondamentali per l'agricoltura e l'intrattenimento.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El caballo, posiblemente el animal doméstico más útil de la historia de la humanidad, existe desde hace cincuenta millones de años. Aunque se ha producido una evolución significativa (sus primeros antepasados medían menos de treinta centímetros), la apariencia básica del caballo ha permanecido invariable. La primera interacción entre caballos y hombres fue a través de la caza, pues los hombres primitivos se alimentaban de ellos. Alrededor del 2500 a. C. empezaron a aparecer en Asia los primeros indicios de razas domesticadas, pero la idea se propagó rápidamente. Las contribuciones del caballo a las ansias de conquista del hombre fueron inmensas, permitiendo las enormes campañas de Gengis Kan y Alejandro Magno. Los españoles introdujeron la cría moderna en Norteamérica en el siglo XVI, dejando a menudo sueltos a sus rebaños importados antes de volver a Europa (ganando un valioso espacio para el oro y otros tesoros). Aunque la importancia de los caballos ha disminuido desde la aparición del motor de combustión interna, siguen siendo todo un regalo en los ámbitos del entretenimiento y la agricultura.

TEXT.English: Pasture

[COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stables[COLOR_REVERT] increase the production of [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK] in a settlement. Stables will give protection from harsh weathre during storms and cold winters for your livestock. In addition to that, your livestock can give birth in a secure environment. You can increase their production even further by upgrading to a [LINK=BUILDING_LARGE_STABLE]Large Stable[\LINK] or the National Wonder: the [LINK=BUILDING_HORSE_MARKET]Grand Horse and Cattle Market[\LINK], which can be built only once.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Breeding Horses, Cattle and Sheep[\LINK].

Stables will give protection from harsh weathre during storms and cold winters for your livestock. In addition to that, your livestock can give birth in a secure environment. You can increase their production even further by upgrading to a [LINK=BUILDING_LARGE_STABLE]Large Stable[\LINK] or the National Wonder: the [LINK=BUILDING_HORSE_MARKET]Grand Horse and Cattle Market[\LINK], which can be built only once.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Breeding Horses, Cattle and Sheep[\LINK].
TEXT.German: In [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stallungen[COLOR_REVERT] sind Nutztiere vor kaltem Wetter im Winter geschützt und können in sicherer Umgebung ihre Jungtiere zur Welt bringen. Dadurch lassen sich [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Nutztiere[COLOR_REVERT] erfolgreicher züchten. Zur Errichtung der Stallungen und der Ranch wird eine gewisse Zahl von Nutztieren benötigt. Der [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]große Viehmarkt[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglicht eine überregionale Zucht und Vermarktung und steigert die Zucht daher noch einmal zusätzlich.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Horse Pasture[COLOR_REVERT] is the native equivalent of the [LINK=BUILDING_STABLE]Stable[\LINK], and it boosts the production of [LINK=YIELD_HORSES]Horses[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_CATTLE]Cattle[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_SHEEP]Sheep[\LINK]. It can only be built by [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]native civilizations[\LINK]. Players will have to settle for the Stable.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_CATTLE_OR_SHEEP_BREEDING]Breeding Horses, Cattle and Sheep[\LINK].

TEXT.English: Coconut Trees

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coconut Trees[COLOR_REVERT] grow in [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK] on [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain. This bonus only applies if the Jungle is left standing, so don't cut it down![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Origin of the coconut palm is supposed to be western coast of Southern America. The coconut palm, Cocos nucifera, is a member of the family Arecaceae. It is the only accepted species in the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which is not a botanical nut. The spelling cocoanut is an old-fashioned form of the word. The term is derived from 16th century Portuguese and Spanish cocos, meaning "grinning face", from the three small holes on the coconut shell that resemble human facial features. Found across much of the tropic and subtropic area, the coconut is known for its great versatility as seen in the many domestic, commercial, and industrial uses of its different parts. Coconuts are part of the daily diet of many people. Its endosperm is known as the edible "flesh" of the coconut; when dried it is called copra. The oil and milk derived from it are commonly used in cooking and frying; coconut oil is also widely used in soaps and cosmetics. The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coconut Trees[COLOR_REVERT] grow in [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungles[\LINK] on [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savannah[\LINK] Terrain. This bonus only applies if the Jungle is left standing, so don't cut it down![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Origin of the coconut palm is supposed to be western coast of Southern America. The coconut palm, Cocos nucifera, is a member of the family Arecaceae. It is the only accepted species in the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which is not a botanical nut. The spelling cocoanut is an old-fashioned form of the word. The term is derived from 16th century Portuguese and Spanish cocos, meaning "grinning face", from the three small holes on the coconut shell that resemble human facial features. Found across much of the tropic and subtropic area, the coconut is known for its great versatility as seen in the many domestic, commercial, and industrial uses of its different parts. Coconuts are part of the daily diet of many people. Its endosperm is known as the edible "flesh" of the coconut; when dried it is called copra. The oil and milk derived from it are commonly used in cooking and frying; coconut oil is also widely used in soaps and cosmetics. The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kokosnussbäume[COLOR_REVERT] wachsen in [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Dschungel[\LINK] auf [LINK=TERRAIN_SAVANNAH]Savanne[\LINK]. Diese Bonus Resource ist nur auf Dschungel gültig, sodass dieser dort ncht entfernt werden sollte.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Ursprung der Kokosnusspalme is wahrscheinlich die westliche Küste von Südamerika. Die Kokosnusspalme, Cocos nucifera, gehört zur Familie der Arecaceae. Der Ausdruck Kokosnuss can sich auf die gesamte Kokosnusspalme, den Samen oder die Frucht, die aus botanischer Sicht eine Nuss ist, beziehen. Das Wort "cocos" lietet sich aus dem spanischen oder portugiesischen Begriff des 16ten Jahrhunderts ab, welcher "grinsendes Gesicht" bedeutet, da die drei Löcher in der Schale einen menschlichen Gesicht ähneln. Fast über das gesamte tropische oder subtropische Gebiet verteilt, ist die Kokosnuss für ihre Vielseitigkeit bekannt, da Teile in vielseitigen Bereichen verwendet werden können. Sie sind Teil der täglichen Nahrung einer großen Anzahl von Menschen. Das getrocknete Fleisch der Kokosnuss wird auch "Copra" genannt. Das Kokosnussöl und die Kokosnussmilch werden oft zum Kochen verwendet. Des weiteren wird Kokosnussöl in Seifen oder Kosmetikprodukten verwendet. Kokosnussmilch dient als erfrischendes Getränk und kann auch zu Alkohol weiterverarbeitet werden. Auch die Schale oder die Palmblätter können vielseitig verwendet werden. In vielen Gesellschaften hat die Kokosnuss daher sogar religiöse und kulturelle Bedeutung gewonnen.
TEXT.Italian: Origine della palma di cocco dovrebbe essere costa occidentale del Sud America. La palma di cocco, Cocos nucifera, è un membro della famiglia Arecaceae. E ' l'unica specie riconosciute nel genere Cocos. Il termine di cocco può riferirsi a tutta palma da cocco , il seme , o la frutta , che non è un dado botanico . La noce di cocco ortografia è una forma antiquata della parola. Il termine deriva dal cocos portoghese e spagnolo XVI secolo, che significa "faccia ghignante", dai tre piccoli fori sul guscio di noce di cocco che assomigliano caratteristiche facciali umane . Trovato in gran parte del tropico e subtropicale zona , la noce di cocco è conosciuto per la sua grande versatilità come si è visto in molti usi domestici, commerciali, industriali e delle sue diverse parti . Noci di cocco fanno parte della dieta quotidiana di molte persone . Il suo endosperma è conosciuto come il commestibile "carne" della noce di cocco , quando secca si chiama copra. L'olio e il latte che ne derivano sono comunemente usati nella cottura e frittura , olio di cocco è anche ampiamente usato in saponi e cosmetici . L' acqua di cocco liquido chiaro all'interno è una bevanda rinfrescante e può essere lavorato per creare l'alcol . Le bucce e le foglie possono essere usate come materiale per fare una varietà di prodotti per l'arredo e decorazione. Essa ha anche un significato culturale e religioso in molte società che lo utilizzano.
TEXT.Spanish: Origin of the coconut palm is supposed to be western coast of Southern America. The coconut palm, Cocos nucifera, is a member of the family Arecaceae. It is the only accepted species in the genus Cocos. The term coconut can refer to the entire coconut palm, the seed, or the fruit, which is not a botanical nut. The spelling cocoanut is an old-fashioned form of the word. The term is derived from 16th century Portuguese and Spanish cocos, meaning "grinning face", from the three small holes on the coconut shell that resemble human facial features. Found across much of the tropic and subtropic area, the coconut is known for its great versatility as seen in the many domestic, commercial, and industrial uses of its different parts. Coconuts are part of the daily diet of many people. Its endosperm is known as the edible "flesh" of the coconut; when dried it is called copra. The oil and milk derived from it are commonly used in cooking and frying; coconut oil is also widely used in soaps and cosmetics. The clear liquid coconut water within is a refreshing drink and can be processed to create alcohol. The husks and leaves can be used as material to make a variety of products for furnishing and decorating. It also has cultural and religious significance in many societies that use it.

TEXT.English: Turkeys

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Turkeys[COLOR_REVERT] forage in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Forests[\LINK] or [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forests[\LINK] on [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Grass[\LINK] Terrain. This bonus only applies if the Forest or Light Forest is left standing, so don't cut it down![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]The domesticated turkey is a large poultry bird. The modern domesticated form descends from the wild turkey, one of the two species of turkey; in the past the ocellated turkey (a species of turkey residing primarily in the Yucatán Peninsula)was also domesticated. The modern domesticated turkey is descended from one of six subspecies of wild turkey: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, found in the area bounded by the present Mexican states of Jalisco, Guerrero, and Veracruz Ancient Mesoamericans domesticated this subspecies; they used its meat and eggs as major sources of protein and employed its feathers extensively for decorative purposes. The Aztecs associated the turkey with their trickster god Tezcatlipoca, perhaps because of its humorous behavior.

Ýòîò ðåñóðñ íå ìîæåò ñóùåñòâîâàòü áåç ëåñà, òàê ÷òî åãî ëó÷øå íå âûðóáàòü![NEWLINE][NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Èíäåéêà - ýòî áîëüøàÿ äîìàøíÿÿ ïòèöà. Íàñòîÿùèé îäîìàøíåííûé âèä ïðîèñõîäèò îò îäíîãî èç 6 ïîäâèäîâ äèêîé èíäåéêè: Meleagris gallopavo, îáèòàþùèå íà òåððèòîðèè øòàòîâ ñîâðåìåííîé Ìåêñèêè: Õàëèñêî, Ãåððåðî è Âåðàêðóñ. Ëþäè èñïîëüçîâàëè ìÿñî è ÿéöà èíäåéêè êàê îñíîâíîé èñòî÷íèê ïðîòåèíà, à ïåðüÿ - êàê äîðîãîå óêðàøåíèå. Àöòåêè àññîöèèðîâàëè èíäåéêó ñî ñâîèì Áîãîì õèòðîñòè - Òýõñêàòëèïîêà, èç-çà çàáàâíîãî ïîâåäåíèÿ æèâîòíîãî.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Truthähne[COLOR_REVERT] gedeihen nur in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Wäldern[\LINK] oder [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] des [LINK=TERRAIN_GRASS]Graslandes[\LINK]. Diese Bonus Resource ist nur in [LINK=FEATURE_FOREST]Wäldern[\LINK] oder [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] gültig, sodass diese dort ncht entfernt werden sollten.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Der domestizierte Truthahn, is a sehr großer Vogel. Die moderne domestizierte Form des Truthahns stammt von einer von sechs Subspezies des wilden Truthahns ab: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, welcher in der Gegend des heutigen Mexiko gefunden wurde. Die erste Domestizierung fand voraussichtlich durch die frühen Mesoamericaner statt. Diese nutzen das Fleisch und die Eier als Hauptquelle für Proteinen und die Federn sehr extensive für dekorative Zwecke. Die Azteken verbanden den Truthahn mit ihrem Gauner-Gott Tezcatlipoca. Vermutlich aufgrund seines teilweise seltsam wirkenden Verhalten.
TEXT.Italian: The domesticated turkey is a large poultry bird. The modern domesticated form descends from the wild turkey, one of the two species of turkey; in the past the ocellated turkey (a species of turkey residing primarily in the Yucatán Peninsula)was also domesticated. The modern domesticated turkey is descended from one of six subspecies of wild turkey: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, found in the area bounded by the present Mexican states of Jalisco, Guerrero, and Veracruz Ancient Mesoamericans domesticated this subspecies; they used its meat and eggs as major sources of protein and employed its feathers extensively for decorative purposes. The Aztecs associated the turkey with their trickster god Tezcatlipoca, perhaps because of its humorous behavior.
TEXT.Spanish: The domesticated turkey is a large poultry bird. The modern domesticated turkey is descended from one of six subspecies of wild turkey: Meleagris gallopavo gallopavo, found in the area bounded by the present Mexican states of Jalisco, Guerrero, and Veracruz Ancient Mesoamericans domesticated this subspecies; they used its meat and eggs as major sources of protein and employed its feathers extensively for decorative purposes. The Aztecs associated the turkey with their trickster god Tezcatlipoca, perhaps because of its humorous behavior.

TEXT.English: Pumpkins

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Pumpkins[COLOR_REVERT] grow on [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK] Terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Light Forest[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]A pumpkin is a gourd-like squash of the genus Cucurbita and the family Cucurbitaceae (which also includes gourds). It commonly refers to cultivars of any one of the species Cucurbita pepo, Cucurbita mixta, Cucurbita maxima, and Cucurbita moschata, and is native to North America. They typically have a thick, orange or yellow shell, creased from the stem to the bottom, containing the seeds and pulp.
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Ñòðàòåãè÷åñêèé ðåñóðñ:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Òûêâà[COLOR_REVERT] , ðàñòåò íà êëåòêàõ [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]ïðåðèé[\LINK] è íå âàæíî, íà îòêðûòîé èëè [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]â ëåñó[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ïðåäûñòîðèÿ:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Òûêâà - ýòî ÷ëåí ñåìåéñòâà Òûêâåííûõ. Îáû÷íî ìû âèäèì òûêâû èç ñîðòîâ Òûêâà Îáûêíîâåííàÿ, Òûêâà Ãèãàíòñêàÿ è Òûêâà Ìóñêàòíàÿ. Ðîäîì ýòî ðàñòåíèå èç Ñåâåðíîé Àìåðèêè. Ïðåäñòàâëÿåò òûêâà èç ñåáÿ òîëñòóþ îðàíæåâóþ èëè æåëòóþ êîðêó ñî ñòåáëåì ñíèçó è ìÿêîòüþ è ñåìåíàìè âíóòðè.
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kürbisse[COLOR_REVERT] wachsen nur auf [LINK=TERRAIN_PLAINS]Prairie[\LINK]. Gelegentlich können besonders gute Anbaugebiete für Kürbisse auch von [LINK=FEATURE_LIGHT_FOREST]Buschland[\LINK] überwachsen sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Die verschiedenen Arten von Kürbissen wurden großteils unabhängig für die gleiche Verwendung domestiziert. Als Zeitpunkt wurde lange etwa 5000 v. Chr. angenommen, was nach Phaseolus und Capsicum wäre. Neuere Funde von Samen domestizierter Kürbisse sind jedoch auf 8000 bis 10.000 v. Chr. zu datieren.[1] Der Garten-Kürbis wurde in Mexiko und im Süden der USA domestiziert, der Moschus-Kürbis in Zentral-Amerika und der Riesen-Kürbis in Südamerika. Es wird angenommen, dass ursprünglich die nahrhaften Samen genutzt wurden, da diese frei von Bitterstoffen sind, während alle Wildformen bittere Früchte besitzen. Durch die Auslese nichtbitterer Formen wurde auch die Nutzung als Gemüse möglich. Schon in präkolumbischer Zeit gab es eine große Sortenvielfalt. Bereits früh kamen Samen auch nach Europa, wo die Kürbisse gerne kultiviert wurden. Die Gattung ist ursprünglich ausschließlich in Amerika beheimatet. Kultiviert werden die domestizierten Arten heute weltweit in den warmen Gebieten.

TEXT.English: Melons

[BOLD]Strategy:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melons[COLOR_REVERT] grow on [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Marsh[\LINK] Terrain that is either open or overgrown by [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Jungle[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Background:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Melon is a name given to various members of the plant family Cucurbitaceae with sweet flavored, fleshy fruit e.g. gourds or cucurbits. Melon can be referred as a plant or a fruit. Many different cultivars have been produced, particularly of muskmelons. The plant grows as a vine. Although the melon is a fruit, some varieties may be considered "culinary vegetables". The word melon derives from Latin melopepo, which is the latinization of the Greek (melopepon), meaning "melon", itself a compound of (melon), "apple" + p?p?? (pepon), amongst others "a kind of gourd or melon".
TEXT.French: [BOLD]Ñòðàòåãè÷åñêèé ðåñóðñ:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Äûíÿ[COLOR_REVERT] ,ðàñòåò íà êëåòêàõ [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]áîëîòà[\LINK] èëè â [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]äæóíãëÿõ[\LINK].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Ïðåäûñòîðèÿ:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Íàçâàíèå ''Äûíÿ'' íîñÿò ðàçëè÷íûå ÷ëåíû ñåìüè ''Òûêâåííûå''. Ñàìî ñëîâî ìîæåò îçíà÷àòü êàê âñå ðàñòåíèå â öåëîì, òàê è ïëîä îòäåëüíî. Ìíîæåñòâî ñîðòîâ äûíè áûëî âûâåäåíî èç ìóñêóñíîé äûíè. Ðàñòåíèå ðàñòåò â âèäå ëîçû. Õîòü äûíþ è ïðåäñòàâëÿþò ôðóêòîì, íåêîòîðûå âèäû ñ÷èòàþò "êóëèíàðíûìè îâîùàìè". Ñàìî ñëîâî ''äûíÿ'' ïðîèñõîäèò îò ëàòèíñêîãî ''melopepo'', êîòîðîå ïðîèñõîäèò îò ãðå÷åñêîãî ''melopepon'', ÷òî çíà÷èò "äûíÿ" .
TEXT.German: [BOLD]Strategie:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Melonen[COLOR_REVERT] wachsen nur auf [LINK=TERRAIN_MARSH]Sumpfland[\LINK]. Gelegentlich können besonders gute Anbaugebiete für Melonen auch von [LINK=FEATURE_JUNGLE]Dschungel[\LINK] überwachsen sein.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][BOLD]Hintergrund:[\BOLD][PARAGRAPH:1]Als Melone bezeichnet man vor allem in subtropischen Gebieten kultivierte Gewächse mit großen, saftreichen Beeren-Früchten (botanischen Gemüsen). Sie gehören zur Familie der Kürbisgewächse (Cucurbitaceae), werden also genau genommen als Gemüse bezeichnet. Der deutsche Name ist von dem griechischen Wort für "Apfel" abgeleitet. Es wird hauptsächlich zwischen Zuckermelonen und Wassermelonen unterschieden. Melonen werden in der Botanik nicht als Verwandtschaftsgruppe angesehen, die Zuckermelonen (Cucumis melo) sind enger mit den Gurken verwandt als mit den Wassermelonen (Citrullus lanatus). Die Frucht wird aufgrund der harten Schale als Panzerbeere bezeichnet.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In sailing, a brigantine is a vessel with two masts, only the forward of which is square rigged. Originally the brigantine was a small ship carrying both oars and sails. It was a favorite of Mediterranean pirates and its name comes from the Italian word brigantino, meaning brigand, and applied by extension to his ship. By the 17th century the term meant a two-masted ship. In the late 17th century, the Royal Navy used the term brigantine to refer to small two-masted vessels designed to be rowed as well as sailed, rigged with square rigs on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigging on the mainmast. By the first half of the 18th century the word had evolved to refer not to a ship type name, but rather to a particular type of rigging: square rigged on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigged on the mainmast. The word "brig" is an 18th century shortening of the word brigantine, which came to mean a vessel square-rigged on both masts. The early Oxford English Dictionary (with citations from 1720 to 1854) still defined brig as being either identical to a brigantine, or alternatively, a vessel of similar sail plan to a modern brig.

By the 17th century the term meant a two-masted ship. In the late 17th century, the Royal Navy used the term brigantine to refer to small two-masted vessels designed to be rowed as well as sailed, rigged with square rigs on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigging on the mainmast. By the first half of the 18th century the word had evolved to refer not to a ship type name, but rather to a particular type of rigging: square rigged on the foremast and fore-and-aft rigged on the mainmast. The word "brig" is an 18th century shortening of the word brigantine, which came to mean a vessel square-rigged on both masts. The early Oxford English Dictionary (with citations from 1720 to 1854) still defined brig as being either identical to a brigantine, or alternatively, a vessel of similar sail plan to a modern brig.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Eine Brigantine ist ein Segelschiff mit zwei Masten, deren vorderer mit Fockmast, der hintere mit Großmast bezeichnet werden. Am Fockmast führt eine Brigantine Rahsegel; am Großmast führt sie teilweise oder ausschließlich Schratsegel. Die Brigantine stellt daher eine Mischform aus Brigg und Schoner dar. Sie kann durch ihre Rahsegel Wind von hinten (raumen Wind) besser ausnutzen als ein Schoner; außerdem kann sie durch ihre Schratsegel höher am Wind segeln als eine Brigg, das heißt, sie kann besser "schräg gegen den Wind" segeln. Ende des 17. Jahrhunderts wurde die Bezeichnung in Nordwesteuropa auf zweimastige, rahgetakelte Segelschiffe übertragen. Seit dem 19. Jahrhundert entstand die heutige Bedeutung des Wortes Brigantine. Je nach Takelung werden verschiedene Segelschiffstypen unterschieden, die heute zusammenfassend als Brigantine bezeichnet werden. Der meist einfach als Brigantine bezeichnete Typ führt am Großmast ein Gaffelsegel und darüber weitere Rahsegel.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantines[COLOR_REVERT] are relatively pricey [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT]. They have four cargo slots, and also four speed, but they are stronger than [LINK=UNIT_MERCHANTMAN]Merchantmen[\LINK] and especially well-protected against [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK], against whom they receive a 10% Defensive bonus.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Brigantines[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].

TEXT.German: Eine [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein starkes, gut geschütztes Handelsschiff.
TEXT.Italian: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.
TEXT.Spanish: A [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Brigantine[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong and well protected merchant vessel.

TEXT.English: [TAB] In the 18th and the earlier part of the 19th centuries, a sloop-of-war was a small sailing warship (also known as one of the escort types) with a single gun deck that carried anything up to eighteen cannons. As the rating system covered all vessels with 20 guns and above, this meant that the term sloop-of-war actually encompassed all the unrated combat vessels including the very small gun-brigs and cutters. In technical terms, even the more specialised bomb vessels and fireships were classed as sloops-of-war, and in practice these were actually employed in the sloop role when not carrying out their specialised functions. A ship sloop was generally the equivalent of the smaller corvette of the French Navy (although the French term also covered ships up up to 24 guns, which were classed as 'post ships' within the Sixth Rate of the British Navy). The name corvette was subsequently also applied to British vessels, but not until the 1830s. A sloop-of-war was smaller than a sailing frigate and outside the rating system. In general, a sloop-of-war would be under the command of a master and commander rather than a post captain, although in day-to-day use at sea the commanding officer of any naval vessels would be addressed as "captain". Until 1794 the master and commander strictly speaking held the permenent rank of lieutenant, and reverted to that rank when he gave up command of the sloop-of-war; in 1794 the rank of commander was created.

TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Kriegsschiffbezeichnung Sloop hat ihren Ursprung in dem gleichnamigen einmastigen Schiffstyp. Sie bildeten im 17. Jahrhundert die kleinsten bewaffneten Marineeinheiten für Unterstützungsaufgaben wie Nachrichtenübermittlung und Aufklärung und waren im Gegensatz zu grösseren Schiffen nicht klassifiziert. Diese Fahrzeuge hatten zunächst einen Leutnant als Kommandanten, jedoch ohne weiteren Offizier, vor allem aber keinen Navigator/Segelmeister (engl. Sailing-Master oder kurz Master). Weil Unterstützungsfahrzeuge in der Seekriegsführung im Verlaufe des 17. Jahrhundert immer bedeutender wurden und vor allem auch abseits der Küsten operierten, wurde auch ein Navigator notwendig. Daraus entstand der Rang des Master and Commander, ein kommandierender Seeoffizier, der zugleich Navigator war.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are the fastest Naval Units in the game, and because of that, they are particularly suitable for exploring the seas of the New World and searching out [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Shipwrecks[\LINK]. They have only one cargo slot, which makes them practically useless as trading vessels, but they can transport [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK] very swiftly to the places where they are needed.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] can cheaply be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are the fastest Naval Units in the game, and because of that, they are particularly suitable for exploring the seas of the New World and searching out [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_GOODY_HUT3]Shipwrecks[\LINK]. They have only one cargo slot, which makes them practically useless as trading vessels, but they can transport [LINK=CONCEPT_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK] very swiftly to the places where they are needed.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] can cheaply be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.German: Obwohl eine [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloop[COLOR_REVERT] kein besonders starkes Kriegsschiff ist, eignet es sich hervorragend zur Aufklärung und auch dazu angeschlagenen Schiffen den Rest zu geben.
TEXT.Italian: Although not very strong, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent for reconaissance and finishing off damaged ships.
TEXT.Spanish: Although not very strong, [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sloops[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent for reconaissance and finishing off damaged ships.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Großer Westindienfahrer wurden entworfen und gebaut um sowohl Passagiere, wie auch Waren zu transportieren. Ein Hauptaugenmerk, war die Fähigkeit sich gegen Piraten zu verteidigen. Durch diese speziellen Eigenschaften stellten sie eine eigene Schiffsklasse dar. Für einen Angreifer ware sie aus der Entfernung oft kaum von einem reinen Kriegsschiff zu unterscheiden. Einige waren tatsächlich relativ schwach bewaffnet, andere jedoch führten eine beachtliche Anzahl an Kanonen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Indiamen were designed to carry both passengers and goods and to defend themselves against piracy, and so constituted a special class of ship. In the period of the Napoleonic Wars they were often painted to resemble warships; an attacker could not be sure if gunports were real or merely paint, and some carried sizeable armaments.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT] available. They have five cargo slots and five speed, and on top of that, are strong enough to match [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] in combat and have even less to fear from [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK]. Because of their strength and ability to attack, the West Indiaman can function both as merchant ship and as warship.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] are the strongest [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT] available. They have five cargo slots and five speed, and on top of that, are strong enough to match [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK] in combat and have even less to fear from [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK]. Because of their strength and ability to attack, the West Indiaman can function both as merchant ship and as warship.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]West Indiamen[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.German: Der [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Großer Westindienfahrer[COLOR_REVERT] ist ein sehr starkes Handelsschiff, welches im Vergleich zur Galeone zwar weniger Frachtraum dafür aber mehr Kanonen hat.
TEXT.Italian: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiaman[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong trading ship, although it lacks some cargo capacity compared to the Galeon due to the higher amount of cannons.
TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]West Indiaman[COLOR_REVERT] is a strong trading ship, although it lacks some cargo capacity compared to the Galeon due to the higher amount of cannons.

TEXT.English: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Ìèëîðä, êîíòðàáàíäèñòû, êîòîðûõ âû íàíÿëè, æäóò âàøèõ óêàçàíèé ïî äîñòàâêå êîíòðîáàíäû â ãîðîä %s1_city.
TEXT.German: Die angeheuerten Schmuggler erwarten in %s1_city Eure Befehle, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: The smugglers we have hired await your orders in %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.French: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Schmugglerschiffe wurden meist sehr günstig und vorallem zweckmässig gebaut. Oft aus günstigerem Holz, wie Tanne. Verglichen mit den traditionellen Bauweisen mit Eiche und anderen Harthölzern, sparte dies nicht nur Kosten, sondern auch Gewicht, was wiederum zu höheren Endgeschwindigkeiten führte um den Königlichen Zollschiffen zu entgehen. Bewaffnet waren Schmugglerschiffe meist nur mit leichten Handwaffen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] The purpose-made smuggling vessels were extremely cheap to manufacture, and were made from fir. Compared to building in traditional English oak this not only saved money, but weight as well, which gave the vessels that much more of a competitive edge in eluding the King's men. To weight the dice still further in their favour, the smugglers armed the ships with carriage guns and smaller swivel guns.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] are small, stealthy vessels that can be used to circumvent the high [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK] your [LINK=RELATIONS_WITH_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. They have two cargo slots, and they can be purchased only in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. While they release you from the duty to pay your taxes, they do demand a small fee, which they need to bribe the King's officials.[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK], and for more information about Smuggling, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK]
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] are small, stealthy vessels that can be used to circumvent the high [LINK=CONCEPT_TAX_RATE]Tax Rate[\LINK] your [LINK=RELATIONS_WITH_KING]King[\LINK] has imposed upon you. They have two cargo slots, and they can be purchased only in [LINK=CONCEPT_PORT_ROYAL]Port Royal[\LINK]. While they release you from the duty to pay your taxes, they do demand a small fee, which they need to bribe the King's officials.[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK], and for more information about Smuggling, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Piracy and Smuggling[\LINK]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Schmugglerschiffe[COLOR_REVERT] ermöglichen es die Steuern in Europa zu umgehen und selbst boykottierte Waren zu verkaufen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to sell goods withouth paying taxes and even sell boycotted goods in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Smuggling Ships[COLOR_REVERT] allow you to sell goods withouth paying taxes and even sell boycotted goods in Europe.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Die Rangers berufen sich auf die Tradition der ersten Siedler in den USA, die unter Ausnutzung des Geländes gegen Indianer und britische oder französische Truppen kämpften. Namenspatron sind Rogers' Rangers, die unter Robert Rogers auf britischer Seite im Franzosen- und Indianerkrieg kämpften. Dessen zusammengestellter Ausbildungsplan aus Berichten der Rogers Ranger sind u.a. bis heute noch Grundlage des Kleinen Krieges. Auch im amerikanischen Bürgerkrieg waren Ranger-Einheiten, vor allem auf konföderierter Seite als Bushwhacker, hinter den feindlichen Linien eingesetzt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Ranger in the original meaning of the word designates a person who is specially trained to traverse rough terrain, esp. woodland, relatively quickly; and who possesses the according survival skills to live in the wilderness for a prolonged amount of time. The term "Ranger" was first used in North America in the early 17th century; however, the first ranger company was not officially commissioned until King Philip's War (1676) and then they were used in the four French and Indian Wars . Rangers also fought in the American Revolution , the War of 1812 , and the American Civil War.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT] are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are experts for terrain and covert operations. Use them wisely for ambushes or getting deep behind enemy lines.[NEWLINE]Rangers get bonuses when fighting in vegetated areas. This bonus applies to both attack and defense, so while the other Terrain unit, the [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenary[\LINK] is particularly strong when attacking in the wild, the Ranger is stronger when defending.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rangers are invisible to almost all units of other European nations, as well as the Royal Army. They can be obtained only by certain [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK]

This bonus applies to both attack and defense, so while the other Terrain unit, the [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_MERC]Native Mercenary[\LINK] is particularly strong when attacking in the wild, the Ranger is stronger when defending.[PARAGRAPH:1]Rangers are invisible to almost all units of other European nations, as well as the Royal Army. They can be obtained only by certain [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK]
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Rangers[COLOR_REVERT] sind Experten für Gelände und versteckte Operationen. Man sollte sie weise für Hinterhalte oder für Aktionen tief hinter den feindlichen Linien nutze.

TEXT.English: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.French: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.German: [TAB] Conquistadores sind Berufssoldaten, die ein breites Spektrum von Kampftaktiken und Waffen einsetzten. Ihre Verbände spezialisierten sich oft auf Kriegsführung, die langes Training bedurfte und für andere Truppenteile zu kostspielig war. Viele junge Europäer traten Einheiten von Conquistadores bei, weil sie sich dadurch einen Weg aus der Armut versprachen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB] Conquistadores were professional warriors, using European tactics, firearms, combat dogs, and cavalry against unprepared groups. Their units would often specialize in forms of combat that required longer periods of training that was too costly for informal groups. European young men enlisted in the units because it was one way out of poverty.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT], experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] would usually fight. Their aptitude in the area of slaughtering Natives makes them quite valuable forces in wars against them, but they will have a hard time fighting other European forces.[PARAGRAPH:1]Conquistadores can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and some [LINK=GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT], experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK] would usually fight. Their aptitude in the area of slaughtering Natives makes them quite valuable forces in wars against them, but they will have a hard time fighting other European forces.[PARAGRAPH:1]Conquistadores can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK], [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK] and some [LINK=GOODY_HUT2]Ancient Ruins[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] sind sehr erfahren in Nahkampf-Situationen und eignen sich deshalb hervorragend für den Kampf gegen Unreinwohner in schwierigem Gelände.

TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, which is the way Natives would usually fight.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT], like regular [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies both on foot or mounted.[NEWLINE]Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain. They are especially strong against [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK], but they can make a valuable contribution in wars against other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Europeans[\LINK] as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]They can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] or certain [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK].
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT], like regular [LINK=UNIT_CONQUISTADOR]Conquistadores[\LINK], are [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies both on foot or mounted.[NEWLINE]Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain. They are especially strong against [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Natives[\LINK], but they can make a valuable contribution in wars against other [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Europeans[\LINK] as well.[PARAGRAPH:1]They can only be obtained through [LINK=CONCEPT_EVENTS]Random Events[\LINK] or certain [LINK=CONCEPT_FATHERS]Founding Fathers[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] sind sehr erfahren in Nahkampf-Situationen und eignen sich deshalb hervorragend für den Kampf gegen Unreinwohner oder berittene Einheiten. Allerdings eignen sie sich auf Grund der Pferde nur für den Kampf in offenem Gelände.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies on foot or mounted. Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Mounted Conquistadores[COLOR_REVERT] are experienced in fighting in close combat, against enemies on foot or mounted. Due to their horses they fight best in open terrain.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bevor Sklaven aus Afrika in großen Mengen in die Neue Welt gebracht wurden, war der Handel mit versklavten Ureinwohnern weit verbreitet. Vorallem in Süd- und Zentralamerika.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Before Slaves from Africa were brought to the New World, the use of labour from enslaved Natives was widely spread, especially in South and Central America.

TEXT.English: You can acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Villages[\LINK], by buying war prisoners of other Natives or by capturing Raiding Parties. They are a slightly less effective than [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] which voluntarily join you, and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].
TEXT.French: You can acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native[\LINK] [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Villages[\LINK], by buying war prisoners of other Natives or by capturing Raiding Parties. They are a slightly less effective than [LINK=UNIT_CONVERTED_NATIVE]Converted Natives[\LINK] which voluntarily join you, and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Versklavte Ureinwohner[COLOR_REVERT] können durch die Eroberung von Ureinwohnerdörfern oder durch Kauf Kriegsgefangener anderer Ureinwohner erlangt werden. Sie sind etwas weniger effektiv als Konvertierte Ureinwohner, die sich euch freiwillig anschliessen.
TEXT.Italian: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered Native Villages of by buying war prisoners of other Natives, that currently lead war against another tribe. They are a little bit less effective than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Converted Natives[COLOR_REVERT] which voluntarily join you
TEXT.Spanish: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Native Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] from conquered Native Villages of by buying war prisoners of other Natives, that currently lead war against another tribe. They are a little bit less effective than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Converted Natives[COLOR_REVERT] which voluntarily join you

TEXT.English: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.French: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Kolonisierung Amerikas vom 16. bis 19. Jahrhundert ging mit einer Massenversklavung von Afrikanern einher, die in allen Teilen des dünn besiedelten Doppelkontinents als billige Arbeitskräfte eingesetzt wurden. Dies betrifft nicht nur die britischen, niederländischen, schwedischen, französischen und spanischen Kolonien, aus denen später die USA entstanden sind, sondern in noch grösserem Umfang Brasilien und die europäischen Kolonien in der Karibik. Auf dem nordamerikanischen Festland erlangte die Sklaverei jedoch Ausprägungsformen, die auf dem Doppelkontinent einzigartig waren, und nach der Gründung der USA stand sie im Spannungsfeld zwischen einer Ökonomie, die auf der Arbeitsleistung von Sklaven erbaut war, und dem politischen Programm einer jungen Nation, deren Selbstverständnis prominent die Idee der Freiheit zugrundelag.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]An estimated 12 million Africans arrived in the Americas from the 16th to the 19th centuries.Of these, an estimated 645,000 were brought to what is now the United States. The usual estimate is that about 15 per cent of slaves died during the voyage, with mortality rates considerably higher in Africa itself in the process of capturing and transporting indigenous peoples to the ships. Approximately 6 million black Africans were killed by others in tribal wars.

TEXT.English: You can buy [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] for very low prices in [LINK=CONCEPT_AFRICA]Africa[\LINK]. They function the same as [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK], and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].

They function the same as [LINK=UNIT_NATIVE_SLAVE]Native Slaves[\LINK], and they can also attempt to flee. They are especially productive when set to work on the fields, but will accomplish next to nothing when put to work inside a building.[PARAGRAPH:2]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SLAVES]Servants, Criminals and Slaves[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Sklaven[COLOR_REVERT] werden durch Handel mit Afrika erlangt. Sie sind exzellente Feldarbeiter. Sklaven können davonlaufen.
TEXT.Italian: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] through trade with Africa. They are very good workers on plot professions.
TEXT.Spanish: You will acquire [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]African Slaves[COLOR_REVERT] through trade with Africa. They are very good workers on plot professions.

TEXT.English: The Slaves we bought from Africa have arrived in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.French: Ìèëîðä, àôðèêàíñêèå ðàáû äîñòàâëåíû â ãîðîä %s1_city.
TEXT.German: Die Sklaven aus Afrika wurden nach %s1_city geliefert, Mylord.
TEXT.Italian: Gli schiavi che abbiamo comprato dall'Africa sono arrivati in %s1_city, Mylord.
TEXT.Spanish: Los esclavos que compramos de África han llegado %s1_city, Mylord.

TEXT.English: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]It is the task and responsibility of a bishop to act as spiritual leader of a colony. Guiding and supporting other preachers and priests to bring true christian believe to the citizens, converting the savages and to ensure that no soul leaves the righteous path of enlightment. Bringing bishops to your colonies is a save way to drastically increas immigration from the old world.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Es ist die Aufgabe und die Verantwortung des Bischofs als geistige Führung in den Kolonien, die Prediger anzuleiten und in ihrer Aufgabe zu unterstützen die Gläubigen zu führen, die Heiden zu bekehren und sicherzustellen, dass niemand vom Pfad der Gerechten abkommt. Einen Bischof in die Kolonien zu bringen ist eine sichere Methode die Immigration wesentlich zu erhöhen.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bishops[COLOR_REVERT] are the best source of [LINK=YIELD_CROSSES]Crosses[\LINK] a colony could wish for. They are even more effective than [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Firebrand Preachers[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]Devout Priests[\LINK], as they receive a 150% bonus in Crosses production, but they are also very rare. You can recruit them at the rare moments the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] offers to send you a Bishop as a reward for your piety.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bishops[COLOR_REVERT] are the best source of [LINK=YIELD_CROSSES]Crosses[\LINK] a colony could wish for. They are even more effective than [LINK=UNIT_PREACHER]Firebrand Preachers[\LINK] or [LINK=UNIT_PRIEST]Devout Priests[\LINK], as they receive a 150% bonus in Crosses production, but they are also very rare. You can recruit them at the rare moments the [LINK=CONCEPT_CHURCH]Archbishop[\LINK] offers to send you a Bishop as a reward for your piety.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Bischöfe[COLOR_REVERT] sind die beste Quelle für [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Kreuze[COLOR_REVERT], die sich eine Kolonie wünschen kann. Sie sind sogar noch effektiver als ein Hetzprediger, allerdings auch viel seltener.

TEXT.English: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.French: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The role of the corvette consisted mostly of coastal patrol, fighting minor wars, supporting large fleets, or participating in show-the-flag missions. The English Navy began using small ships in the 1650s, but described them as sloops-of-war rather than corvettes. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.
TEXT.German: Während des Zeitalters der Selgelschiffe waren Corvette kleinere bis mittlere Kriegsschiffe. Die Aufgabe der Corvette bestand üblicherweise aus Küstenpatroulien und Unterstüzung grösserer Flotten. Die Englische Navy begann die Nutzung solcher Schiffe in den 1650ern, nannte sie aber zu beginn eher Sloop-Of-War, als Corvette. Die erste namentliche Reference einer Corvette findet sich in der Französichen Marine um 1670 und gilt als der Ursprung dieser Bezeichnugn. Die Bezeichnung Corvette diente ab diesem Zeitpunkt zur Beschreibung eines Schiffes, welches kleiner als eine Frigatte, aber grösser als eine Sloop war.
TEXT.Italian: During the Age of Sail, corvettes were one of many types of smaller warships. The first reference to a corvette was with the French Navy in the 1670s, which may be where the term originated. The Royal Navy did not use the term until after the Napoleonic Wars to describe a small unrated vessel somewhat larger than a sloop and smaller than a frigate.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and especially well suited for hunting [LINK=UNIT_PRIVATEER]Privateers[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_PIRATE_FRIGATE]Pirate Frigates[\LINK], receiving a 20% attack bonus against both. They are fast units, and cheaper to purchase than [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK]. In combat, though, they will not stand much of a chance against Frigates, or other ships that are even stronger.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].

They are fast units, and cheaper to purchase than [LINK=UNIT_FRIGATE]Frigates[\LINK]. In combat, though, they will not stand much of a chance against Frigates, or other ships that are even stronger.[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_SHIPYARD]Shipyard[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_BLADES]Blades[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvetten[COLOR_REVERT] sind excellent als Eskorte für Handelsschiffe oder zur Jagd auf Piraten geeignet. vFür grössere Kriegsschiffe, wie eine Frigatte, ein Linienschiff oder gar ein königliches Linienschiff, stellen sie jedoch keine ernsthafte Herausforderung dar. Desweiteren können sie keine Städte bombardieren.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and very well suited for hunting Privateers. However, they are no real match for bigger warships like Frigates, Ships of the Line or Man-O-Wars and also cannot bombard cities.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Corvettes[COLOR_REVERT] are excellent escorts for your merchant ships and very well suited for hunting Privateers. However, they are no real match for bigger warships like Frigates, Ships of the Line or Man-O-Wars and also cannot bombard cities.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coastal ships [COLOR_REVERT]can be used for transports of goods and peoples near the coast. They are small, but fast and indeed faster and more spacious than wagon trains. They can only be used near the coast but they cannot use ocean fields so that they cannot sail to Europe. The small coastal ship has two slots for goods and peoples, the bigger one has three slots.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] [COLOR_REVERT] . , , . , , . , - .
TEXT.German: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Küstensegler[COLOR_REVERT] sind eigens fr den küstennahen Transport von Waren und Menschen gedacht. Sie sind zwar klein, dafür aber sehr wendig und außerdem deutlich geräumiger und schneller als ein Planwagen. Sie können nur in [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Küstennhe[COLOR_REVERT] eingesetzt werden. Den Ozean kann man mit ihnen nicht befahren, so dass sie nicht nach Europa segeln können. Der Kleine Küstensegler hat zwei Frachtplätze, der große Küstensegler drei. Beide können sich nur geringfügig verteidigen.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coastal ships [COLOR_REVERT]can be used for transports of goods and peoples near the coast. The small coastal ship has two slots for goods and peoples.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coastal Shipping [COLOR_REVERT] is - of course - operated near the coast. Small and habile as well as spacious sailling vessels are suitable to transport goods and peoples between the colonies already shortly after the landing in the New World. Due to their small size these coastal vessels cannot sail to Europe or Africa.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT] [COLOR_REVERT], , . , . - .
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Küstenschifffahrt[COLOR_REVERT] wird, wie der Name schon sagt, nur nahe der Küste betrieben. Kleine und wendige - dafür aber recht geräumige Segler eignen sich bestens dazu, bereits sehr früh nach der Landung in der neuen Welt Schiffe zu bauen, mit denen Waren schnell zwischen den Kolonien hin- und hertransportiert werden können, bis ein Straennetz errichtet werden kann. Aufgrund ihrer geringen Größe knnen die Küstensegler nicht auf den Ozean hinaus fahren und auch nicht nach Europa oder Afrika segeln.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Coastal Shipping [COLOR_REVERT] is - of course - operated near the coast. TEXT.English: Towards the end of the 15th century, the caravel was occasionally modified by giving it the same rig as a carrack with a foresail, square mainsail and lateen mizzen, but not the carrack's high forecastle or much of a sternpalace, which would make it unweatherly. In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). It was in such ships that Christopher Columbus set out on his expedition in 1492 - Santa Maria was a ~100 ton carrack (same as: nau) which served as the flagship, and Pinta and Niña were smaller caravels of around 15-20 m with a beam of 6 m and displacing around 60-75 tons. In the first half of the 16th century, the Portuguese created a specialized fighting ship also called caravela redonda to act as an escort in Brazil and in the East Indies route. It had a foremast with square sails and three other masts with a lateen each, for a total of 4 masts. The hull was galleon-shaped, and some experts consider this vessel a forerunner of the fighting galleon. The Portuguese Man o' War was named after this curious type of fighting ship which was in use until the 17th century.

In this form it was sometimes known as caravela redonda (a bulging square sail is said to be round, redonda, in the Iberian tradition). TEXT.German: Gegen Ende des 15ten Jahrunderts wurde die Caravelle manchmal modfifiziert indem man ihr ein Rig-Segel als Frontsegel, ein Rechteck-Segel als Hauptsegel und ein Lateen-Selge in der Mitte gabe, aber nicht aber nicht die hohen Anbauten an Front und Bug anbrachte. In dieser Form war sie als Caravela Redonda bekannt. In solchen Schiffen setzte Christoph Columbus Segel für seine Expedition im Jahre 1492. In der ersten Hälfte des 16ten Jahrunderts setzten die Portugiesen diese Schiffe auch als Eskorten auf ihren Handelsrouten nach Brasilien ein.

TEXT.English: Among [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Merchant Ships[COLOR_REVERT], [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] are smaller and have less cargo space than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT], but faster and more maneuverable. They have three cargo slots, so they still are quite useful as trading vessels. They are slightly stronger than [LINK=UNIT_CARAVEL]Caravels[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_FLUYT]Fluyts[\LINK], and also have the ability to attack other units, but they usually don't stand much of a chance in combat with [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Warships[COLOR_REVERT] or [LINK=CONCEPT_SMUGGLING]Pirate Ships[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1][COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] can be recruited in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK] and be built in colonies with a [LINK=BUILDING_DRYDOCK]Drydock[\LINK] or one of its upgrades. Like most ships, they require [LINK=YIELD_CANNONS]Cannons[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_ROPE]Ropes[\LINK], [LINK=YIELD_SAILCLOTH]Sailcloth[\LINK] and [LINK=YIELD_TOOLS]Tools[\LINK].[PARAGRAPH:1]For a comparison of all ships that are available, see [LINK=CONCEPT_SHIPS]Ships[\LINK].

TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] sind kleiner und haben weniger Frachtraum als [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Karracke[COLOR_REVERT]. Dafür sind sie schneller und maneuvrierfähiger.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Caravelas Redondas[COLOR_REVERT] are smaller and have less cargo space than [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Carracks[COLOR_REVERT], but faster and more maneuverable on the other side.
