TEXT.English: Colonial Congress

The Congress was a convention of delegates called together from the Thirteen Colonies that became the governing body of the United States during the American Revolution. The Congress met from 1774 to 1789 in three incarnations. The first call for a convention was made over issues of the Intolerable Acts penalizing Massachusetts. Though at first divided on independence and a break from Crown rule, the new Congress in July 1776 gave a unanimous vote for independence, issued the Declaration of Independence as a new nation, the United States of America. It established a Continental Army, giving command to one of its members George Washington of Virginia. It waged war with Britain, made a military treaty with France, and funded the war effort with loans and paper money.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Colonial Congress[COLOR_REVERT] is a National Wonder, and as such, it can be built only once. It serves as an upgrade to the [LINK=BUILDING_PALACE]Government Palace[\LINK], granting an even higher production bonus for [LINK=YIELD_BELLS]Liberty Bells[\LINK] and even more jobs for [LINK=PROFESSION_STATESMAN]Statesmen[\LINK] to produce them. If you employ [LINK=UNIT_STATESMAN]Elder Statesmen[\LINK] or even [LINK=UNIT_NOBLE]Famous Noblemen[\LINK], Liberty Bell production can reach enormous levels.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information about Liberty Bells, see [LINK=CONCEPT_REBEL_SENTIMENT]Rebel Sentiment[\LINK].

TEXT.German: In einer neu gegründeten Siedlung gibt es lediglich ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Basislager[COLOR_REVERT] als behelfsmäßigen ersten Verwaltungssitz und eine [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Zimmerei[COLOR_REVERT]. Ein [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Gemeindehaus[COLOR_REVERT] und die Standard-Gebäude müssen erst errichtet werden. Das Gemeindehaus kann dann weiter zur [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Stadthalle[COLOR_REVERT], diese dann zum [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Rathaus[COLOR_REVERT] und dieses dann zum [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Regierungspalast[COLOR_REVERT] ausgebaut werden. Je fortschrittlicher der Verwaltungssitz ist, desto mehr fortschrittliche andere Gebäude werden zum Bau freigeschaltet.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Zum Bau des Regierungspalastes braucht man etwas Silber. Die Treffen der Volksvertreter sollen ja schließlich in einem repräsentativen Ambiente stattfinden.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In einer Stadt mit einem Regierungspalast heilen Einheiten nach einem Kampf schneller. Tipp: Städten, die weit im Osten liegen, kann der Regierungspalast helfen, im Unabhängigkeitskrieg die Angriffe der Königsarmee zu überstehen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]In den Verwaltungsgebäuden können Bürger arbeiten, um [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Freiheitsglocken[COLOR_REVERT] zu erzeugen. Tipp: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Weise Staatsmänner[COLOR_REVERT] sind dabei am effektivsten.

TEXT.Spanish: The [COLOR_BUILDING_TEXT]Government Palace[COLOR_REVERT]

TEXT.English: Central Customs Authority
Grand Horse and Cattle Market

A mortar is an indirect fire weapon that fires explosive projectiles known as (mortar) bombs at low velocities, short ranges, and high-arcing ballistic trajectories. It is typically muzzle-loading (i.e., loading from the forward, open end of the gun's barrel) and has a barrel length less than 15 times its caliber. Mortars have existed for hundreds of years, first seeing use in siege warfare. From the 18th to the early 20th century very heavy, relatively immobile siege mortars were used, of up to one metre calibre, often made of cast iron and with outside barrel diameter many times that of the bore diameter. In the French and Indian War (1754 - 1762) especially the French troops used 15 inch mortars while sieging British fortifications.
TEXT.French: A mortar is an indirect fire weapon that fires explosive projectiles known as (mortar) bombs at low velocities, short ranges, and high-arcing ballistic trajectories. It is typically muzzle-loading (i.e., loading from the forward, open end of the gun's barrel) and has a barrel length less than 15 times its caliber. Mortars have existed for hundreds of years, first seeing use in siege warfare. From the 18th to the early 20th century very heavy, relatively immobile siege mortars were used, of up to one metre calibre, often made of cast iron and with outside barrel diameter many times that of the bore diameter. In the French and Indian War (1754 - 1762) especially the French troops used 15 inch mortars while sieging British fortifications.
TEXT.German: Ein Mörser ist ein Steilfeuergeschütz mit kurzem Rohr, mit dem auf kurze Distanz Explosivgeschosse verschossen werden. Mörser sind typischerweise Vorderlader, deren Rohr im Verhältnis zu ihrem Kaliber deutlich kürzer ist, wodurch sie ihr typisches Aussehen erhalten. Mörser existieren bereits sehr mehreren hundert Jahren. Sie waren in erster Linie Waffen des Festungs- und Stellungskrieges. Als solche hatten sie die Aufgabe eine feindliche Befestigung sturmreif zu schießen. Schwere Mörser wirkten vor allem durch Zerstören von Befestigungswerken, Deckungen und Hindernissen. Im Französisch-Indianischen Krieg (1754-1762) setzen vor allem die Franzosen schwere 15 Zoll Mörser zur Bekämpfung britischer Befestigungsanlagen ein.

TEXT.English: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mortar[COLOR_REVERT] is a special Siege Weapon. Due to its heavy calibre and the possibility to fire explosives in a high-arcing way, a mortar is a perfect siege weapon against enemy [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Cities[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_FORTS]Forts[\LINK], reducing their defensive structures to rubble very quickly. However, in open terrain a mortar is very unprotected and needs protection by friendly infantry or cavalry. A mortar cannot be build in the New World or purchased in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. The only way to obtain them is through diplomatic offers by foreign [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK], which only happen if you have good diplomatic relations with that King's [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonies[\LINK] in the New World.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK]
TEXT.French: The [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mortar[COLOR_REVERT] is a special Siege Weapon. Due to its heavy calibre and the possibility to fire explosives in a high-arcing way, a mortar is a perfect siege weapon against enemy [LINK=CONCEPT_SETTLEMENTS]Cities[\LINK] and [LINK=CONCEPT_FORTS]Forts[\LINK], reducing their defensive structures to rubble very quickly. However, in open terrain a mortar is very unprotected and needs protection by friendly infantry or cavalry. A mortar cannot be build in the New World or purchased in [LINK=CONCEPT_EUROPE]Europe[\LINK]. The only way to obtain them is through diplomatic offers by foreign [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK], which only happen if you have good diplomatic relations with that King's [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]Colonies[\LINK] in the New World.[PARAGRAPH:1]For more information, see [LINK=CONCEPT_MILITARY_UNITS]Military Units[\LINK]
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mörser[COLOR_REVERT] ist eine besondere Art von [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Belagerungsartillerie[COLOR_REVERT]. Durch sein schweres Kaliber und die Möglichkeit, Explosivgeschosse in steilem Bogen zu verschießen, ist ein [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Mörser[COLOR_REVERT] eine besonders wirkungsvolle Waffe um feindliche Städte und Forts anzugreifen. In freiem Gelände ist er jedoch so gut wie ungeschützt, so dass er immer von eigener Infanterie oder Kavallerie begleitet werden sollte. In der neuen Welt gibt es keine Waffenschmiede, die einen Mörser herstellen kann. Ein Mörser kann daher nur aus Europa in die neue Welt verschifft werden.
TEXT.Italian: A mortar is a special siege weapon. Due to its heavy calibre and the possibility to fire explosives in a high-arcing way, a mortar is a perfect siege weapon against enemy cities and forts. However, in opten terrain a mortar is very unprotected and needs protection by friendly infantry or cavalry. A mortar cannot be build in the New World and therefore only can be shipped from Europe into the New World.

TEXT.English: Saloon

A [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Saloon[COLOR_REVERT] is a kind of bar particular to the Old West. Saloons served customers such as fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, prospectors, miners, and gamblers. The first saloon was established at Brown's Hole, Wyoming, in 1822, to serve fur trappers. By the late 1850s the term saloon had begun to appear in directories and common usage as a term for an establishment that specialized in beer and liquor sales by the drink, with food and lodging as secondary concerns in some places. By 1880, the growth of saloons were in full swing. In Leavenworth, Kansas there were about 150 saloons and four wholesale liquor houses. A saloon's appearance varied from when and where it grew. As towns grew, the saloons became more refined. The bartender prided himself on his appearance and his drink pouring abilities. Early saloons and those in remote locations were often crude affairs with minimal furniture and few decorations. A single wood-burning stove might warm such establishments during the winter months. By way of entertainment, saloons offered dancing girls, some of whom occasionally or routinely doubled as prostitutes. Many saloons offered Faro, poker, brag, three-card monte, and dice games.
TEXT.French: A [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Saloon[COLOR_REVERT] is a kind of bar particular to the Old West. Saloons served customers such as fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, prospectors, miners, and gamblers. The first saloon was established at Brown's Hole, Wyoming, in 1822, to serve fur trappers. By the late 1850s the term saloon had begun to appear in directories and common usage as a term for an establishment that specialized in beer and liquor sales by the drink, with food and lodging as secondary concerns in some places. By 1880, the growth of saloons were in full swing. In Leavenworth, Kansas there were about 150 saloons and four wholesale liquor houses. A saloon's appearance varied from when and where it grew. As towns grew, the saloons became more refined. The bartender prided himself on his appearance and his drink pouring abilities. Early saloons and those in remote locations were often crude affairs with minimal furniture and few decorations. A single wood-burning stove might warm such establishments during the winter months. By way of entertainment, saloons offered dancing girls, some of whom occasionally or routinely doubled as prostitutes. Many saloons offered Faro, poker, brag, three-card monte, and dice games.
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Saloon[COLOR_REVERT] ist eine Art Bar, wie sie typisch für den Alten Westen war. Saloons bedienten Kunden wie Pelzjäger, Cowboys, Soldaten, Goldsucher, Minenarbeiter und Spieler. Die Erscheinung eines Saloons variierte sehr stark, je nachdem wann und wo er entstand. Als die Städte wuchsen, wurden Saloons auch größer. Frühe Saloons waren oft schäbige Buden, die kaum Möbel hatten und lediglich durch ein kleines Holzfeuer im Ofen gewärmt wurdne. Spätere große Saloons boten Tanzmädchen und oft auch Prostituierte an. Dazu meist noch eine große Vielfalt an Glücksspielen, wie Faro, Poker oder Würfelspielen. Der erste Saloon eröffnete 1822 in Brown's Hole, Wyoming für Trapper. In den späten 1850'er Jahren waren Saloons bereits allgemein bekannt als Schenken, die auf Bier und Schnaps spezialisiert waren. Vielerorts dienten Saloons auch als Gasthäuser, in denen man neben Getränken auch Speisen servierte und Zimmer für die Nacht mieten konnte. Ihre absolute Blütezeit hatten Saloons in den 1880'er Jahren. In Leavenworth, Kansas, gabe es um die 150 Saloons und vier Großmärkte für Schnapps. Je nach Größe und Entwicklung einer Stadt konnte ein Saloon eine einfache Bretterbude oder auch ein vornehmes Etablissement sein.

Saloons served customers such as fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, prospectors, miners, and gamblers. The first saloon was established at Brown's Hole, Wyoming, in 1822, to serve fur trappers. By the late 1850s the term saloon had begun to appear in directories and common usage as a term for an establishment that specialized in beer and liquor sales by the drink, with food and lodging as secondary concerns in some places. By 1880, the growth of saloons were in full swing. In Leavenworth, Kansas there were about 150 saloons and four wholesale liquor houses. A saloon's appearance varied from when and where it grew. As towns grew, the saloons became more refined. The bartender prided himself on his appearance and his drink pouring abilities. Early saloons and those in remote locations were often crude affairs with minimal furniture and few decorations. A single wood-burning stove might warm such establishments during the winter months. By way of entertainment, saloons offered dancing girls, some of whom occasionally or routinely doubled as prostitutes. Many saloons offered Faro, poker, brag, three-card monte, and dice games.

TEXT.English: Theatre

A [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]theatre[COLOR_REVERT] is the simple evolution of a tavern or a saloon or other little theatres. At the end of this cultural development stands the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]grand opera[COLOR_REVERT]. In a theatre or an opera the audience can enjoy high-quality acts and shows of best-known colonial actors. A theatre or an opera represent a certain cultural development of a colony. From a certain growth the superior residents like merchants, officers, officials, planter, of a colony demand for more cultural development to develop their colony. In a theatre or an opera these citizens can enjoy colonial life, acting or political discussions. The building of an opera represents highest (cultural) development of a colony.
TEXT.French: A [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]theatre[COLOR_REVERT] is the simple evolution of a tavern or a saloon or other little theatres. At the end of this cultural development stands the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]grand opera[COLOR_REVERT]. In a theatre or an opera the audience can enjoy high-quality acts and shows of best-known colonial actors. A theatre or an opera represent a certain cultural development of a colony. From a certain growth the superior residents like merchants, officers, officials, planter, of a colony demand for more cultural development to develop their colony. In a theatre or an opera these citizens can enjoy colonial life, acting or political discussions. The building of an opera represents highest (cultural) development of a colony.
TEXT.German: Ein [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Theater[COLOR_REVERT] ist die natürliche kulturelle Weiterentwicklung einer Taverne oder eines Saloons oder anderer kleiner Schauspielhäuser. Am Ende dieser kulturellen Entwicklung steht die [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Oper[COLOR_REVERT]. In Theatern und Opern gibt es Aufführungen bekannter kolonialer Schauspieler, die auch qualitativ über die Aufführungen in den einfachen Saloons hinausgehen. Ein Theater oder eine Oper repräsentiert eine gewisse, insbesondere natürlich kulturelle Entwicklung einer Kolonie. Ab einer bestimmten Größe "verlangen" besonders die höher gestellten Kolonisten, wie Händler, Plantagenbesitzer, Kolonialbeamte, hohe Offiziere und andere nach mehr Kultur, um die Kolonie auch in dieser Hinsicht voranzubringen. In einem Theater oder einer Oper können sich die feineren Herrschaften der Kolonie amüsieren, der Kultur und dem Schauspiel hingeben, politische Diskussionen führen und ganz allgemein den Fortschritt der Kolonie genießen. Der Bau einer Oper repräsentiert die höchste kulturelle Entwicklung einer Kolonie in der neuen Welt.

TEXT.English: Continental Guard:Continental Guards
TEXT.German: Kontinentalgarde:Kontinentalgarde
TEXT.Italian: Continental Guard:Continental Guards
TEXT.Spanish: Continental Guard:Continental Guards

TEXT.English: Continental Guard Soldiers are hardened warriors, educated on the field of battle in the ways of war. They received the best training and equipment available. And by the 17th century, there was more than enough "education" going on in Europe to train the budding soldier. Dozens of conflicts, including the Thirty Years' War and the Eighty Years' War, ravaged Europe in this century, making the availability of fresh training for green soldiers an easily-accessed commodity.
TEXT.French: Continental Guard Soldiers are hardened warriors, educated on the field of battle in the ways of war. They received the best training and equipment available. And by the 17th century, there was more than enough "education" going on in Europe to train the budding soldier. Dozens of conflicts, including the Thirty Years' War and the Eighty Years' War, ravaged Europe in this century, making the availability of fresh training for green soldiers an easily-accessed commodity.
TEXT.German: Die Soldaten der Kontinentalgarde sind abgehärtete Krieger, die auf dem Schlachtfeld in der Kunst des Krieges unterwiesen wurden. Und im 17. Jahrhundert gab es in Europa mehr als genug "Unterrichtsmöglichkeiten" für Soldaten. Dutzende von Konflikten, unter anderem der Dreißigjährige Krieg oder der Achtzigjährige Krieg, wüteten in Europa während dieses Jahrhunderts, so dass es für unerfahrene Soldaten genügend Anfängertrainingsmöglichkeiten gab.
TEXT.Italian: I soldati guardisti sono guerrieri incalliti, educati sui campi di battaglia. Ed entro il XVII secolo, in Europa c'erano abbastanza "scuole" per educare qualsiasi giovane soldato. Decine di conflitti, tra cui la Guerra dei Trent'anni e la Guerra degli 80 anni, devastarono l'Europa in questo secolo, semplificando l'addestramento dei militari in erba.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Soldados guardia son guerreros curtidos, educados en el arte de la guerra en los campos de batalla. Y, durante el s. XVII, había "educación" más que suficiente en Europa para entrenar al soldado en ciernes. Decenas de conflictos, incluyendo la Guerra de los Treinta Años y la de los Ochenta Años, asolaron Europa durante ese siglo, haciendo que el entrenamiento de los soldados novatos fuera un bien de fácil acceso.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT] are expensive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are real experts in fighting other Infantry units with muskets. They are quite hard to obtain, and usually will only be provided by [LINK=RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK] of other colonies, as long as your relation with those nations are good.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Continental Guards[COLOR_REVERT] are expensive [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]Elite Units[COLOR_REVERT] that are real experts in fighting other Infantry units with muskets. They are quite hard to obtain, and usually will only be provided by [LINK=RELATIONS_TO_KING]Kings[\LINK] of other colonies, as long as your relation with those nations are good.
TEXT.German: Die [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Kontinentalgarde[COLOR_REVERT] sind Elitetruppen und sogar kampfstärker als die Offiziere. Eine ideale Kontereinheit gegen die "Hessen" des Königs oder andere Infanterie mit Musketen.
TEXT.Italian: I [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]soldati gardisti[COLOR_REVERT] sono molto più feroci, in combattimento, di quelli comuni! Sono la chiave per conquistare gli insediamenti nemici, oltre che per proteggere il tuo.
TEXT.Spanish: Los [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Soldados guardia[COLOR_REVERT] son mucho más fieros en combate que los Soldados corrientes. Son la clave para tomar los asentamientos enemigos, así como para defender los propios.

TEXT.English: In the British colony of Massachusetts Bay, all able-bodied men between the ages of 16 and 60 were required to participate in their local militia. As early as 1645 in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, some men were selected from the general ranks of town-based "training bands" to be ready for rapid deployment. Men so selected were designated as minutemen. They were usually drawn from settlers of each town, and so it was very common for them to be fighting alongside relatives and friends.
TEXT.French: In the British colony of Massachusetts Bay, all able-bodied men between the ages of 16 and 60 were required to participate in their local militia. As early as 1645 in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, some men were selected from the general ranks of town-based "training bands" to be ready for rapid deployment. Men so selected were designated as minutemen. They were usually drawn from settlers of each town, and so it was very common for them to be fighting alongside relatives and friends.
TEXT.German: Schon zu Zeiten der Massachusetts Bay Colony 1645 wurden einige Männer aus dem Aufgebot der verschiedenen örtlichen Milizen für schnellen Einsatz ausgewählt. Die Miliz der Provinz Massachusetts war bereits in vielen Konflikten im Kampf eingesetzt worden, so in König Philipps Krieg, im Franzosen- und Indianerkrieg und schließlich in der Schlacht von Lexington und Concord. Jede Generation der Siedler in Neuengland war mit dem Kämpfen vertraut, jeder Ort besaß eine Miliz, und jeder wehrfähige Mann zwischen 16 und 60 war verpflichtet, seinen Dienst in der Miliz zu leisten. Allerdings gab es hier viele Ausnahmeregelungen, zum Beispiel für bestimmte Berufsgruppen. Der Dienst in der Miliz wurde in sogenannten Militia Acts und nach dem Ausbruch des Unabhängigkeitskrieges in Militia Bills geregelt. Viele dieser Männer waren Landwirte. Viele waren untereinander verwandt, und so war es üblich, neben seinen Cousins und Schwägern zu kämpfen.
TEXT.Italian: In the British colony of Massachusetts Bay, all able-bodied men between the ages of 16 and 60 were required to participate in their local militia. As early as 1645 in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, some men were selected from the general ranks of town-based "training bands" to be ready for rapid deployment. Men so selected were designated as minutemen. They were usually drawn from settlers of each town, and so it was very common for them to be fighting alongside relatives and friends.
TEXT.Spanish: In the British colony of Massachusetts Bay, all able-bodied men between the ages of 16 and 60 were required to participate in their local militia. As early as 1645 in the Massachusetts Bay Colony, some men were selected from the general ranks of town-based "training bands" to be ready for rapid deployment. Men so selected were designated as minutemen. They were usually drawn from settlers of each town, and so it was very common for them to be fighting alongside relatives and friends.

TEXT.English: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Settler Militias[COLOR_REVERT] are troops that individual Colonies levy if they feel unprotected. They are not a fully trained and professional army, so they are comparitively weak and most suited for defending their home cities, for which they receive a small combat bonus. This is often enough for repelling [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native Raids[\LINK], but they don't really stand a chance against an Artillery attack of another [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European nation[\LINK], or your own [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]When they are formed, the colonies where they appear take some [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their stores and some money from your Treasury to support them. There are few other ways of obtaining these units.
TEXT.French: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Settler Militias[COLOR_REVERT] are troops that individual Colonies levy if they feel unprotected. They are not a fully trained and professional army, so they are comparitively weak and most suited for defending their home cities, for which they receive a small combat bonus. This is often enough for repelling [LINK=CONCEPT_NATIVES]Native Raids[\LINK], but they don't really stand a chance against an Artillery attack of another [LINK=CONCEPT_RIVAL_COLONIES]European nation[\LINK], or your own [LINK=CONCEPT_RELATIONS_TO_KING]King[\LINK][PARAGRAPH:1]When they are formed, the colonies where they appear take some [LINK=YIELD_FOOD]Food[\LINK] from their stores and some money from your Treasury to support them. There are few other ways of obtaining these units.
TEXT.German: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Siedlermilizen[COLOR_REVERT] sind Truppen, die von den Kolonien ausgehoben werden, wenn diese sich ungeschützt fühlen. Sie stellen keine voll ausgebildete Berufsarmee dar. Daher sind sie auch vergleichsweise schwach und sollten für den Schutz der Städte eingesetzt werden.
TEXT.Italian: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Settler Militias[COLOR_REVERT] are troops that Colonies levy if they feel unprotected. They are no fully trained and professional army. They are comparable weak and most suited for defending their home cities.
TEXT.Spanish: [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]Settler Militias[COLOR_REVERT] are troops that Colonies levy if they feel unprotected. They are no fully trained and professional army. They are comparable weak and most suited for defending their home cities.

TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]A Missionary hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]A Missionary hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE]A Preacher hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE]A Preacher hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE]Ein Prediger, der diese Worte hörte, hat spontan entschieden sich eurer Sache anzuschliessen.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]A Preacher hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]A Preacher hearing those words has spontaneously decided to join your cause.

TEXT.English: Word about your refusal to help the poor and desperate is spread.
TEXT.French: Word about your refusal to help the poor and desperate is spread.
TEXT.German: Die Kunde über eure Weigerung den Armen und Hilfsbedürftigen zu spenden verpreitet sich.
TEXT.Italian: Word about your refusal to help the poor and desperate is spread.
TEXT.Spanish: Word about your refusal to help the poor and desperate is spread.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE]The King is very unpleased by the loss of prestige for his Nation through your actions.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE]The King is very unpleased by the loss of prestige for his Nation through your actions.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE]Der König ist sehr unerfreut über den Verlust an Ansehen, den Eure Taten seiner Nation bescheren.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]The King is very pleased by the loss of prestige for his Nation through your actions.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]The King is very pleased by the loss of prestige for his Nation through your actions.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE]Your prestige at other European Nations has suffered.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE]Your prestige at other European Nations has suffered.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE]Euer Ansehen bei anderen europäischen Nationen ist gefallen.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]Your prestige at other Europeans Nations has suffered.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]Your prestige at other Europeans Nations has suffered.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE]The faithful citizens in your capitol are marching on the streets.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE]The faithful citizens in your capitol are marching on the streets.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE]Die Gläubigen demonstrieren auf den Strassen der Hauptstadt gegen Eure Handlung.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]The faithful citizens in your capitol are marching on the streets.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]The faithful citizens in your capitol are marching on the streets.

TEXT.English: [NEWLINE]Immigration of faithful christians to your colony has decreased.
TEXT.French: [NEWLINE]Immigration of faithful christians to your colony has decreased.
TEXT.German: [NEWLINE]Die Immigration gläubiger Christen in die Kolonien ist gesunken.
TEXT.Italian: [NEWLINE]Immigration of faithful christians to your colony has decreased.
TEXT.Spanish: [NEWLINE]Immigration of faithful christiansto your colony has decreased.

TEXT.English: Sail to Africa
TEXT.German: Nach Afrika segeln
TEXT.Italian: Fai vela per l'Africa
TEXT.Spanish: Navegar a Africa

TEXT.English: The ship sails off the map and can be accessed through the Africa Screen.
TEXT.German: Das Schiff segelt über die Karte hinaus und ist dann über den Afrika-Bildschirm verfügbar.
TEXT.Italian: La nave salpa al di fuori della mappa; puoi accedervi attraverso la schermata Africa.
TEXT.Spanish: El barco navega hasta salir del mapa, pero se puede acceder a él mediante la pantalla de Africa.
